comments.author: cgens@socialtradefair.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

The gallery displays first image and thumbnails below, normally when you scroll on these images full size image appears very quickly (as it is already downloaded).

Now with Firefox 4 I scroll on thumbnails and they stay frozen.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Open url
2.Scroll on thumnails
3.See that nothing happens

comments.raw_text: Seems to be a Site Issue if you look at the Bunch of JS Warnings in the Error Console and by the Fact, that the same Error shows against Goggle Chrome 13 dev.

comments.raw_text: Seems to be website related. Reproducible on Chrome.
comments.text: Seems to be website related. Reproducible on Chrome.
comments.author: vlad.ghetiu@softvision.ro
cgens@socialtradefair.com
comments.text:
Hello,

In SAFARI it does work and after downgrading to FIREFOX 3.6.15 is also works. 

How it can be a site issue if site works ok with previous FIREFOX version??

Thanks for your support, New 4.0 is great as it is really fast and appearance is much better but I lose a critical feature and many people use the same technology for galleries.

I wait for your comments.

Best regards,

Carlos

comments.creator: xtc4uall@gmail.com
comments.text:
(In reply to comment #4)
The Issue is clearly reproducible against Google Chrome	13.0.751.0 (Official Build 83481) canary as stated by me above.

Is presume JS Engine Changes on both Browsers led to the Library the Site is using not working properly anymore.
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to comment #4)
The Issue is clearly reproducible against Google Chrome	13.0.751.0 (Official Build 83481) canary as stated by me above.

Is presume JS Engine Changes on both Browsers led to the Library the Site is using not working properly anymore.

comments.author: vlad.ghetiu@softvision.ro
u279076@disabled.tld
comments.raw_text: The site appears to be using dynamically created HTML with Joomla! 1.5. This might be a Tech Evangelism bug (either for the website or Joomla! or the gallery plugin).  Considering Joomla! 1.6 is the latest version, it might be worth reaching out to ask them to upgrade.
comments.text: The site appears to be using dynamically created HTML with Joomla! 1.5. This might be a Tech Evangelism bug (either for the website or Joomla! or the gallery plugin).  Considering Joomla! 1.6 is the latest version, it might be worth reaching out to ask them to upgrade.
